panels.description: There are various states that a server instance can be in. If servers are communicating properly, all report the same states for all servers. However, if there is a network partition, or a server leaves the group, then different information could be reported, depending on which server is queried. If the server has left the group then it cannot report updated information about the other servers' states. If there is a partition, such that quorum is lost, servers are not able to coordinate between themselves. As a consequence, they cannot guess what the status of different servers is. Therefore, instead of guessing their state they report that some servers are unreachable.
panels.title: Group Replication Service States

panels.description: This table shows network and status information for replication group members. The network addresses shown are the addresses used to connect clients to the group, and should not be confused with the member's internal group communication address specified by group_replication_local_address.
panels.title: Replication Group Members

panels.description:
Lag in seconds from when the LAST transaction is COMMITTED in the Primary and the time on local Replica.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description:
Time difference from the moment the transaction is COMMITTED on the Primary and the time 
transaction ENTER the local queue on the Replica.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Transport Time

panels.description:
Time difference from the moment the transaction has being COMMITTED on the Primary and the time transaction exit the queue to be apply in the local Replica.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Replication Delay

panels.description:
Time pass to apply the transaction on the local node.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Transaction Apply Time

panels.description:
Time spent by transaction inside the local queue in the Replica. 

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Transaction Time Inside the Local Queue

panels.description: The number of transactions that have been checked for conflicts.
panels.title: Checked Transactions

panels.description: Number of transaction rows which can be used for certification, but have not been garbage collected. Can be thought of as the current size of the conflict detection database against which each transaction is certified.
panels.title: Transactions Row Validating

panels.description:
Number of transactions that members have received from the group and applied.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Applied Transactions

panels.description:
Number of transactions which originated on members and were sent to the group.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Sent Transactions

panels.description:
The number of transactions that members have received from the replication group which are waiting to be applied.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Received Transactions Queue

panels.description:
Number of transactions which originated on members and were rolled back by the group.

Notice: Collected for MySQL 8.x
panels.title: Rolled Back Transactions

panels.description: The number of transactions in the queue pending conflict detection checks. Once the transactions have been checked for conflicts, if they pass the check, they are queued to be applied as well.
panels.title: Transactions in the Queue for Checking

panels.description: The number of transactions that have not passed the conflict detection check.
panels.title: Detected Conflicts
